placeToVisit.summary: Srinagar is one of several places that have been called the "Venice of the East".Lakes around the city include Dal Lake – noted for its houseboats – and Nigeen Lake. Apart from Dal Lake and Nigeen Lake,Wular Lake and Manasbal Lake both lie to the north of Srinagar. Wular Lake is one of the largest fresh water lakes in Asia.
placeToVisit.places: Dal Lake,Nigeen Lake,Wular Lake,Manasbal Lake,Mughal gardens,Chashma Shahi (the royal fountains),Pari Mahal (the palace of the fairies),Nishat Bagh (the garden of spring),Shalimar Bagh,Jawaharlal Nehru Memorial Botanical Garden,Sher Garhi Palace,Gulab Bhavan,Shankaracharya Temple,Kheer Bhawani Temple

placeToVisit.summary: Srinagar is one of several places that have been called the "Venice of the East".Lakes around the city include Dal Lake – noted for its houseboats – and Nigeen Lake. Apart from Dal Lake and Nigeen Lake,Wular Lake and Manasbal Lake both lie to the north of Srinagar. Wular Lake is one of the largest fresh water lakes in Asia.
placeToVisit.places: Dal Lake,Nigeen Lake,Wular Lake,Manasbal Lake,Mughal gardens,Chashma Shahi (the royal fountains),Pari Mahal (the palace of the fairies),Nishat Bagh (the garden of spring),Shalimar Bagh,Jawaharlal Nehru Memorial Botanical Garden,Sher Garhi Palace,Gulab Bhavan,Shankaracharya Temple,Kheer Bhawani Temple

placeToVisit.summary: Ladakh a word which means "land of high passes",is a region in the state of Jammu and Kashmir of Northern India sandwiched between the Karakoram mountain range to the north and the Himalayas to the south and is situated at the height of 11,400 ft.The Indian portion of Ladakh is composed of the Leh and Kargil districts. The Leh district is the second largest district of India,covering more than half the area of Jammu and Kashmir,of which it is the eastern part.
placeToVisit.places: Razi khar (Chiktan Khar),Suru valley,Kargil,Zangskar,Zangla,Rangdum,Padum,Phukthal,Sani Monastery,Stongdey,Shayok Valley,Sankoo,Salt Valley,Manali to Ladakh,the Nubra valley,Pangong tso,Tso moriri,the Indus valley,Markha valley,Ladakh monastery trek,South Zangskar,Trans-Zangskar Expedition,Spiti to Ladakh,Spiti to Pitok to Hemis,Rupshu,the Great Salt lakes,Chadar Ice trek,Padum-Phuktal,Padam to Darcha,Panikhar to Heniskot,Padum to Manali,Lamayuru-Martselang,Lamayuru - Alchi,Kala Pattar trek,Pahal

placeToVisit.summary: The Taj Mahal attracts a large number of tourists. UNESCO documented more than 2 million visitors in 2001,which had increased to about 7–8 million in 2014. A two-tier pricing system is in place,with a significantly lower entrance fee for Indian citizens and a more expensive one for foreigners. Most tourists visit in the cooler months of October,November and February.
placeToVisit.places: Taj-Mahal,Agra Fort,Fatehpur Sikri,Akbar's Tomb,Jamā Masjid,Rām Bāgh,Gurudwara Guru ka Taal,Mankameshwar Temple

placeToVisit.summary: Kutch literally means something which intermittently becomes wet and dry; a large part of this district is known as Rann of Kutch which is shallow wetland which submerges in water during the rainy season and becomes dry during other seasons. The same word is also used in Sanskrit origin for a tortoise. The Rann is famous for its marshy salt flats which become snow white after the shallow water dries up each season before the monsoon rains.
placeToVisit.places: Rann of Kutch,Kutch Desert Wildlife Sanctuary,Kalo Dungar – The black hill,Topansar Lake – The picnic spot,Mandvi Beach,Kutch Museum,Dholavira – A historical excavation site,Siyot Caves,Bhadreshwar Jain Temple,Aina Mahal

placeToVisit.summary: The Meghalayan subtropical forests support a vast variety of flora and fauna. Meghalaya has 2 National Parks and 3 Wildlife Sanctuaries. Meghalaya also offers many adventure tourism opportunities in the form of mountaineering,rock climbing,trekking and hiking,caving (spelunking) and water sports. The state offers several trekking routes,some of which also afford an opportunity to encounter rare animals. The Umiam Lake has a water sports complex with facilities such as rowboats,paddleboats,sailing boats,cruise-boats,water-scooters and speedboats.
placeToVisit.places: Cherrapunji,Living root bridges,Elephant Falls,Shadthum Falls,Weinia falls,Bishop Falls,Nohkalikai Falls,Langshiang Falls,Sweet Falls,

placeToVisit.summary: Mysore is a major tourist destination in its own right and serves as a base for other tourist attractions in the vicinity. The city receives a large number of tourists during the 10-day Dasara festival. One of the most visited monuments in India,the Amba Vilas Palace,or Mysore Palace,is the centre of the Dasara festivities.
placeToVisit.places: Mysore Palace,Jaganmohana Palace,Sand Sculpture Museum,Chamundeshwari Temple,St. Philomena's Church,Wesley's Cathedral,Mysore Zoo,Brindavan Gardens,Somanathapura

placeToVisit.placeName: Rishikesh - Yoga Capital of the World
placeToVisit.bestTimeToVisit: September - October to mid November and early March - April to first week of May.
placeToVisit.summary: it is known as the 'Gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas'[3] and 'Yoga Capital of the World'.It is approximately 25 km (16 mi) north of the city Haridwar and 43 km (27 mi) southeast of the state capital Dehradun. According to Census of India,2011 Rishikesh had a population of 102,138 making it the seventh most populated city and in the state of Uttarakhand. It is known as the pilgrimage town and regarded as one of the holiest places to Hindus. Hindu sages and saints have visited Rishikesh since ancient times to meditate in search of higher knowledge.
placeToVisit.places: Ram Jhula,Hanuman Temple,Hindu Temple,Ghats by the River Ganges,Lakshman Jhula,Muni Ki Reti,Parmarth Niketan

placeToVisit.summary: Manali is named after the Sanatan Hindu lawgiver Manu. The name Manali is regarded as the derivative of 'Manu-Alaya' which literally means 'the abode of Manu'. It is a resort town nestled in the mountains of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh near the northern end of the Kullu Valley. It is a popular tourist destination and serves as the gateway to Lahaul and Spiti district as well as Leh.
placeToVisit.places: Hadimba Temple,Tibetan Monasteries,Manu Temple,Nehru Kund,Jogini Falls,Solang Valley,Kothi,Rahala Waterfalls,Gulaba,Naggar Village

placeToVisit.summary: Ranthambhore is the fortieth largest national park in northern India,covering 392 km². Ranthambhore was established as the Sawai Madhopur Game Sanctuary in 1955 by the Government of India and was declared one of the Project Tiger reserves in 1973.Ranthambhore wildlife sanctuary is known for its Bengal tigers,and is one of the best places in India to see these animals in their natural jungle habitat. Tigers can be easily spotted even in the daytime.
placeToVisit.places: Indian leopard,nilgai,wild boar,sambar,striped hyena,sloth bear,southern plains gray langur,rhesus macaque,mugger crocodile,chital.

placeToVisit.summary: Jaipur is a major tourist destination in India forming a part of the Golden Triangle. In the 2008 Conde Nast Traveller Readers Choice Survey,Jaipur was ranked the 7th best place to visit in Asia. It is famous for organising events such as Vastara,Jaipur Jewellery Show,Stonemart 2015 and Resurgent Rajasthan Partnership Summit 2015.
placeToVisit.places: Hawa Mahal,Jal Mahal,City Palace,Amer Fort,Jantar Mantar,Nahargarh Fort,Jaigarh Fort,Birla Mandir,Galtaji,Govind Dev Ji Temple,Garh Ganesh Temple,Moti Dungri Ganesh Temple,Sanghiji Jain temple,Jantar Mantar,Amer Fort,Albert Hall Museum.

placeToVisit.summary: Shimla was declared as the summer capital of British India. After independence,the city became the capital of Punjab and was later named the capital of Himachal Pradesh. It is the principal commercial,cultural and educational centre of the state.
placeToVisit.places: The Ridge,Christ Church,Jakhoo Hill,Summer Hill,Rashtrapati Niwas,Viceregal Lodge,Tara Devi Temple,Johnnie's Wax Museum,Annandale.

placeToVisit.summary: Tourism in Mumbai is an industry that attracts almost 6 million tourists per year,making it the 30th-most visited location worldwide. With a metro population of approximately 20 million,Mumbai is the largest city in India and the 10th largest city in the world.
placeToVisit.places: Gateway of India,Elephanta Caves,Marine Drive,Haji Ali Dargah,Kanheri Caves,EsselWorld,Juhu Beach,Siddhivinayak Temple,Girgaum Chowpatty,Hanging Gardens of Mumbai,Flora Fountain,Kamala Nehru Park,Bandra–Worli Sea Link,Rajabai Clock Tower,Aksa Beach,Mumba Devi Temple,Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Museum,Nehru Science Centre

placeToVisit.summary: Lonavla and the adjacent Khandala are twin hill stations. Tourism peaks during the monsoon season. The name Lonavla is derived from the Sanskrit lonavli,which refers to the many caves.  It is known for its production of the hard candy chikki and is also a major stop on the railway line connecting Mumbai and Pune.
placeToVisit.places: Karla Caves,Bhaja Caves,Lohagad and Visapur,Tungi fort.

placeToVisit.summary: Mahabaleshwar is a small town and a municipal council in Satara district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. It is a hill station located in the Sahyadri mountain range. With one of the few evergreen forests of India,it served as the summer capital of Bombay province during the British Raj.
placeToVisit.places: Venna Lake,Lingmala Waterfall,Elephant's head Point,Wilson Point of Sunrise,Arthur Seat Mahabaleshwar Point,Parsi Point,Kates Point,Connaught Peak,Echo point,Panch Ganga Mandir,Chinaman Waterfall

placeToVisit.summary: Sikkim is a state in Northeast India. It borders the Tibet Autonomous Region of China in the north and northeast,Bhutan in the east,Nepal in the west and the Indian state of West Bengal in the south. Sikkim is also located close to India's Siliguri Corridor near Bangladesh. Sikkim is the least populous and second smallest among the Indian states. A part of the Eastern Himalaya,Sikkim is notable for its biodiversity,including alpine and subtropical climates,as well as being a host to Kanchenjunga,the highest peak in India and third highest on Earth. Sikkim's capital and largest city is Gangtok. Almost 35% of the state is covered by the Khangchendzonga National Park.
placeToVisit.places: Lake Tsomgo,Yumthang Valley of Flowers,Gurudongmar Lake,Khangchendzonga National Park,Rumtek Monastery,Goecha La,Khecheopalri Lake,Mount Pandim,Baba Harbhajan Singh Temple,Zemu Glacier,Siniolchu Mountain,Samdruptse Statue,Banjhakri Falls and Energy Park,Buddha Park of Ravangla,Sikkim Himalayan Zoological Park

placeToVisit.summary: Darjeeling can be reached by the 88 km (55 mi) long Darjeeling Himalayan Railway from New Jalpaiguri,or by National Highway 55,from Siliguri,77 km (48 mi) away. Bus services and hired vehicles connect Darjeeling with Siliguri and Darjeeling has road connections with Bagdogra,Gangtok and Kathmandu and the neighbouring towns of Kurseong and Kalimpong. The official languages of Darjeeling are Bengali and Nepali.
placeToVisit.places: Happy Valley Tea Garden,Darjeeling Himalayan Railway,Dhirdham Temple,Observatory Hill,St. Andrew's Church,War Memorial,Peace Pagoda,Chowrasta and the Mall,Darjeeling Hill Station

placeToVisit.summary: Coorg is rated as one of the top hill station destinations in India. In July and August,rainfall is intense,and there are often showers into November.
placeToVisit.places: Kanive temple,Kaveri River in Kushalnagara,Tibetan Buddhist Golden temple,Suntikoppa temple,Onkareshwara temple

placeToVisit.summary: Chikmagalur is a town located in the Chikmagalur district in the Indian state of Karnataka. Chikmagalur district is the birthplace of coffee in India. Located in the foothills of the Mullayanagiri range,the town with its favorable climate and coffee estates attracts tourists from around the state.
placeToVisit.places: Mullayanagiri,Baba Budangiri (Datta Peeta),Kemmangundi,Z point,Hebbe Falls,Kallathi Falls,Ballalarayanadurga Hill,Land of Coffee

placeToVisit.summary: Wayanad is a district in the north-east of Kerala state,India with headquarters at the town of Kalpetta. It is set high on the Western Ghats with altitudes ranging from 700 to 2100 m. The district was formed on 1 November 1980 as the 12th district in Kerala by carving out areas from Kozhikode and Kannur districts.
placeToVisit.places: Wayanad Wildlife Sanctuary,Edakkal Caves,Soochipara Falls,Banasura Hill,Kuruvadweep,Thirunelli Temple,Pookode Lake,Ambukuthi mala,Chembra Peak,Neelimala Viewpoint,Chain Tree,Valliyoorkkavu,Lakkidi View Point,Muthanga forest,Assumption Forane Church,Aranamala Peak,Hanging Bridge,Wayanad Churam,Chembra Peak

placeToVisit.summary: Alappuzha is a city and a municipality in Kerala with an urban population of 174,164 and third among the districts having highest literacy rate in Kerala. In 2016,Centre for Science and Environment rated Alappuzha as the top cleanest town in India followed by Mysuru & Panaji. Alappuzha is considered to be the oldest planned city in this region and the lighthouse built on the coast of the city is the first of its kind along the Laccadive Sea coast (reference encyclopaedia of Kerala in Malayalam language).
placeToVisit.places: Vembanad,Alappuzha Beach,Marari Beach,Ambalappuzha Sri Krishna Temple,Basilica of St. Mary - Champakulam,Revi Karuna Karan Memorial Museum,Alappuzha lighthouse,Punnamada Kayal,Alleppey Beach,International Coir Museum,The Great Backwaters,Brackish Lagoons Alleppey,Chavara Bhavan,BoatHouse Alleppey,Mount Carmel Cathedral,Kidangamparambu Sree Bhuvaneswari Temple,Kanichukulangara devi temple,Lighthouse House Museum,St. Thomas Church,Ambalapuzha Beach

placeToVisit.summary: Munnar is a town and hill station located in the Idukki district of the southwestern Indian state of Kerala. Munnar is situated at around 1,600 metres (5,200 ft) above mean sea level, in the Western Ghats mountain range. Munnar is also called the "Kashmir of South India" and is a favorite destination for honeymoon.
placeToVisit.places: Eravikulam National Park,Mattupetty Dam,Anamudi,Pothamedu View Point,Kolukkumalai Tea,KFDC Floriculture Centre,Dream Land Fun and Adventure,Wonder Valley Adventure and Amusement Park,Photo Point,Attukad Waterfall,Munnar Tent Camp,Pothamedu - Aanakkal view point,Mount Carmel Roman Catholic Church,Munnar Scenery,parvathi amman temple,Sun Moon Valley Boating Centre,Munnar Hillstation kerala,Wild Eye Adventures Jeep Safari &village Tour,Tata Tea Garden,Echo Point,Reserve Forest,Thalayar View point,Laxmi Tea Estate

placeToVisit.summary: Hampi,also referred to as the Group of Monuments at Hampi,is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in east-central Karnataka,India. It became the centre of the Hindu Vijayanagara Empire capital in the 14th century. Chronicles left by Persian and European travellers,particularly the Portuguese,state Hampi was a prosperous,wealthy and grand city near the Tungabhadra River,with numerous temples,farms and trading markets. By 1500 CE,Hampi-Vijayanagara was the world's second-largest medieval-era city after Beijing,and probably India's richest at that time,attracting traders from Persia and Portugal.
placeToVisit.places: Virupaksha Temple,Matanga Hill,Achyutaraya Temple,Vijaya Vittala Temple,Saasivekaalu Ganesha,Kadalekalu Ganesha,Hazara Rama Temple,Hemakuta Hill Temple,Lotus Mahal Hampi,Royal Enclosure,Queen's Bath,Pampa Sarovar,Ugra Narasimha Temple,Sunset point Hemakuta,Kings Balance,Mathanga Hill,Hanuman Temple,Elephant Stable,Stone chariot,Monkey Temple,Anjanadri Hill,Sunrise Sunset Point - Matanga Hill

placeToVisit.summary: Ooty,also known as Udhagamandalam,is a hill station in the state of Tamil Nadu,in southern India. Surrounded by trees,central Ooty Lake is a huge artificial expanse of water with pleasure boats. On the slopes of nearby Elk Hill,the Rose Garden is home to over 2,000 varieties of roses. The Government Botanical Garden,created in the 19th century,features ferns,orchids and a prehistoric,fossilized tree.
placeToVisit.places: Botanical Gardens,Rose Garden,St. Stephen's Church,Doddabetta,Toda Temple,Elk Hill Murugan Temple,Italian garden,Pykara,Bhavani temple,Avalanche Lake,Ooty View point,Emerald Lake, Dodobetta Tea Park,Pine forest

placeToVisit.summary: Pondicherry (or Puducherry),a French colonial settlement in India until 1954,is now a Union Territory town bounded by the southeastern Tamil Nadu state. Its French legacy is preserved in its French Quarter,with tree-lined streets,mustard-colored colonial villas and chic boutiques. A seaside promenade runs along the Bay of Bengal and passes several statues,including a 4m-high Gandhi Memorial.
placeToVisit.places: Sri Aurobindo Ashram,Promenade Beach,Arulmigu Manakula Vinayagar Temple,Rock Beach,Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Jesus,Immaculate Conception Cathedral,Aayi Mandapam,Old Lighthouse,Varadharaja Perumal Temple,Matrimandir,Auroville Beach,Puducherry Beach,Puducherry Science Centre & Planetarium,Auro Beach

placeToVisit.summary: The Andaman Islands are an Indian archipelago in the Bay of Bengal. These roughly 300 islands are known for their palm-lined,white-sand beaches,mangroves and tropical rainforests. Coral reefs supporting marine life such as sharks and rays make for popular diving and snorkeling sites. Indigenous Andaman Islanders inhabit the more remote islands,many of which are off limits to visitors.
placeToVisit.places: Havelock Island,Baratang Island,Radhanagar Beach,Viper Island,Mount Harriet National Park,Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park,North Bay Island,Chidiya Tapu,Saddle Peak,Ross Island,South Andaman district,Forest Museum,Bharatpur Beach - Neil Island,Sri Vetrimalai Murugan Temple,Collinpur Beach,New Wandoor Beach,Laxmanpur Beach,Rajiv Gandhi Statue

placeToVisit.summary: Lakshadweep is a tropical archipelago of 36 atolls and coral reefs in the Laccadive Sea,off the coast of Kerala,India. Not all of the islands are inhabited,and only a few are open to visitors (permits required). Kavaratti,one of the more developed islands,is home to dozens of mosques,including the ornately decorated Ujra Mosque,as well as Kavaratti Aquarium,showcasing regional fish,shark and coral species.
placeToVisit.places: Agatti Island,Bangaram Atoll,Kadmat Island,Kalpeni,Kiltan,Minicoy Island Lighthouse,Amini Wildlife Sanctuary
